item.title: Introducing Elm as a frontend contender
item.description: Preamble In the NAIS feature team, our tasks usually involve writing abstractions for developers. These abstractions usually emerge in the form of API backends, Kubernetes operators or sidecars, command-line tools, and the like. And, rarely, we dawdle in web frontend development, which is largely an unknown domain to us. We don’t mind: React is the de facto framework for frontend application development, at least at NAV. And, to use React, the application must be written in Javascript or Typescript.
